comment.author: 79549245@N06
comment._content: Its still there though entrance and some of the windows have been modified. Street View

comment.author: 79549245@N06
comment._content: There were four Ordinance Survey centres in Ireland—Dublin, Belfast, Cork, and Ennis. The Ordnance Survey House in College Road, Ennis, is now Maoin Cheoil an Chláir. Maoin Cheoil an Chláir was opened by President Mary Robinson in 1994. It was the first music school in Ireland to include both classical and traditional music on an equal basis in its constitution. www.maoincheoil.com/Live/about-us.php

comment.author: 79549245@N06
comment._content: Ennis Grammar School, county Clare, had quite a short life span closing in the 1890, whereupon the Ordnance Survey took over use of the building www.highschooldublin.com/the_trust.htm Therefore date is earliest 1890
